title: 1955 Chevrolet 3100

description: Now for sale in our Houston Showroom is this beautiful 1957 Chevrolet 3100. This Ã¢??57 Chevy just says American made all of it. It is powered by a 350 CID V8 with the company of a 3-speed automatic transmission. The small additional of chrome on the Moroso valve covers, and the chromed air cleaner case makes for a much more appealing engine compartment. This truck is a very nice driver, it starts right up with no issue and brakes straight and drives straight as well. The exterior of this truck is in great condition. It has a very clean red paint with a very nicely executed bed that is a mix of metal and wood. The wood has been stained evenly throughout the bed and has a matching luggage box stacked on top. This is one truck that was truly built to catch peoples eye going down the road. You will notice the exhaust runs straight out the back through a solid piece of diamond plate aluminum. The wheels mesh perfectly with this truck with the chrome and red lines that match the body of the truck. The tires have plenty of tread life in them and ready to hit the road and take you to your next local car meet. Moving to the interior you will find it is in great condition. The grey leather bench seat is in like new condition, with the door panels to match. The custom gauge cluster and chromed steering column assist in keep the flow of the exterior going, and truly flaunting how nice this piece of American history is. This truck is worth a look, and is awaiting a new owner to take it back out on the road. For more information on this 1957 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup call the Houston Showroom at 832-243-6220 or email houston@gatewayclassiccars.com

description: This 1955 Chevrolet 3100 1/2 Ton Stepside Shortbed 2 Door Pickup
Stock # F13247
is available in our Fairfield, CA showroom and any inquiries may be directed to us at 707-419-8200 or by email at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
Sensational 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Stepside Shortbed Pickup

New to our Fairfield showroom is this gorgeous 1955 Chevrolet 3100 1/2 Ton Stepside Shortbed 2 Door Pickup with black exterior paint and a matching black cloth interior.  You’ll find a Chevy 350 cid V-8 engine under the hood with an Edelbrock  manifold and carburetor, a four-speed manual transmission with Hurst floor linkage.  It also has a beautiful Oak bed in the back with old school Centerline wheels to complete the look.  This prestigious pickup has been very tastefully restored throughout and it would make an excellent weekend cruiser or a great start for someone who wants to fully customize their own resto-mod pickup.
Beautiful Older Restoration w/ Sensational Curb Appeal

In terms of condition, this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 1/2 Ton Stepside Pickup really impresses as an older restoration that has received immaculate care in recent years.  As you can see from the photographs, the body lines are exceptional and the paint still shines bright up close.  The hardwood bed and metal dividers also stand out with very little noticeable wear, while the engine compartment resembles a fresh install with lots of chrome and polish.  Most would consider this a high level driver with tons of upside due to extensive upgrades and a nice balance between classic charm and real world performance.

Additionally, this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup drives like a champion with very nice acceleration throughout the gears, nice handling and a smooth overall ride.  It needs nothing to be enjoyed right away and this prestigious classic is available at a steal of an asking price.
Available at a Steal of a Price for this Level of Quality

Overall, this 1955 Chevrolet 3100 Shortbed Pickup is in very nice condition and it is ready to be enjoyed right away as a high end driver.  It would also make an excellent project vehicle to take to an entirely new level as well though, so it should appeal to a wide variety of collectors.  Either way, this one is priced to sell or offers an excellent value for one lucky collector.  For more information about this impressive vehicle, visit our Fairfield, California showroom, give us a call at 707-419-8200, or email us at [Sales@SpecialtySales.com](
mailto:Sales@SpecialtySales.com
).  Be sure to mention
Stock # F13247
as well.

Legal Disclosures: Specialty Sales Classics has advertised and sold thousands of classic cars since our founding in 1978. We strongly encourage any and all buyers who are unable to view the vehicle in-person to perform a Pre-Purchase Inspection (by an independent party of their choosing) prior to the purchase.  Given the age of many of our vehicles, it is extremely difficult to adequately describe all aspects of each vehicles condition in the limited space available and we have learned that these Pre-Purchase Inspections are helpful to all parties involved.

The information for this vehicle was provided by the current owner and it is not certified by Specialty Sales Classics. Therefore, it is in no way guaranteed as a basis of purchase. Any statements such as original or numbers-matching should be verified independently by the buyer prior to purchase.
title: 1955 Chevrolet 3100

description: 1957 Chevrolet 3100 Shortbed Custom Truck.This truck was a nut and bolt restoration that took several years to do. We will describe the truck inside and out.Â A beautiful deep dark purple color with lots of pearl. The paint is so deep that you can see your reflection in it. The truck is painted inside and out. The inside of the cab, doors, jambs, dash and interior are all the same dark purple. The inside of the bed is painted to match. The exhaust on the truck looks great it is custom as well. The exhaust comes out just above the rear bumper and towards the back. The bed is custom as well. The chrome strips accent and highlight the depth in the wood. The wood in the bed is an exotic wood known as Purple Heart. The wood is custom cut and finished to put into the truck.The interior of the truck as been finished in grey and black highlights. The seat is new along with the rest of the interior. The dash looks great as well as the custom gauges. The glass is all new. The door glass has been converted to a one piece glass with a nice kit from the Truck Shop. The truck does not have a heater or ac. crate motor 400 along with an automatic 400 transmission. The motor and transmission run and sound great. The motor puts down enough power to light the tires up and it still runs very cool. The aluminum four core radiator ensure that the truck runs nice and cool. The front end is off a Chevy Camaro and the rear-end is a Chevy rear end with 3.73 posi-traction rear-end. The lug bolt pattern is all the same around the truck (5 x 4 3/4). The battery is relocated to the bottom of the bed. Also the disc brake booster has been relocated. The engine bay is clean and the wires are hidden.Â The truck is currently registered, clean title in my name. -Vehicle is on consignment and at our clients home -Please Call First and talk to a rep at 231-468-2809 EXT 1 -Showroom is by appointment only Please Call -If you would like a FREE Listing please visit our consignment page or Call

title: 1947 Chevrolet 3100

description: 1953 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup For Sale- ACAA Award Winner LMC is very proud to offer for sale this 1953 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup The 1953 Model 3100 Chevrolet Pickup came at the end of a relatively short-lived era of truck that began in the 1948 model year. The 3100 was the first major development after World War II and was one of the most popular trucks on the market. From 1948 through 1953 there were just a few changes to the Chevy 3100, including slight grille adjustments, while the engine gradually got stronger. The 1950 model may have been the most popular of the era, but the 1953 had a few more years of development, making it a bit more advanced. When introduced in 1948 it had a 216-cubic inch engine, but by 1953 it was sporting a 261-cubic inch powerplant with increased horsepower and more torque. This beautiful 1953 Chevrolet 3100 has been professionally restored to a concours level.  Many NOS parts were used in the restoration to complete this award-winning restoration. The truck has been finished in a stunning Red on Black interior with wood bed accents. This truck was heavily optioned including such options as Side Mount Tire Carrier, Rear Bumper, Rear Corner Windows, Truck Directional Lamps, Dual Fog Lamps, White Sidewall Tires, Accessory Hood Ornament, Wheel Trim Rings, Right Side Tail Lamp, Chrome Bumpers, Front Bumper Guards, Chrome Wheel Covers, Right Sunvisor, AM Radio, Heater & Defroster, and Glove Compartment Light. Powered by its original 261 cubic inch inline 6 and backed by a 3 speed manual transmission, this Chevrolet truck drives like the day it rolled off the assembly line. Due to its high-level restoration, this truck has gone on to win many awards such as The North-East Chevy/GMC Truck Club Truck Meet-First Place, AACA- First Place, and many more. It has also been featured in the Standard Catalog Of American Trucks. This award winning 1953 Chevrolet 3100 Pickup is perfect for the collector who is looking for a post war pickup truck to add to their collection. Not too many Chevrolet 3100’s were built this highly factory optioned making this particular truck very rare. Also, It’s award winning pedigree proves its restoration was of the best quality. This 1953 Chevrolet 3100 is the perfect addition to any Bow-Tie Enthusiasts Garage. Additional Details: 1953 CHEVROLET 3100 PICKUP -
